name: doil
short_description:
depend order install list ; doil-10.0.1

* works in Debian OS dpkg packaging (perhaps templates can be hackd for other)

* doil is like dpkg + dselect but with mini txt menu + conflict resolver, quick.  all in one yet small , hackable!

* doil uses new capability of using gdeptrace (dep-trace) which orders things by all dependancies and acts in that order (not just on dependancies listed for 1 pkg).  for one thing that means "remove and re-install all related" can work right.  see manual for why else total depends do change order.  at time of writing no other tool in BSD, debian, etc did total depends except by tsort which how used was wrong.

* has ability to do work for src pkg, like git/apt-get -s but more, but is not fully implemented due to disperate pkging rules etc

        NEWS!
                * big improvements since 9
                * more likely packaging (using automake)
                * real darn close to beta !

(doil was examples/ in dep-trace)
summary: depend order install list ; apt-get w/total depends
